title: Monsoon Update ‚Äì Heavy Rain Warning in 3 States next 48 Hours, Cold Wave Alert - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update ‚Äì Heavy Rain Warning in 3 States next 48 Hours, Cold Wave Alert
Priyanka Singh
November 10, 2025 - 10:47 AM

Join
Follow
Follow

Share on Media

Facebook
WhatsApp
X
LinkedIn
Telegram

Monsoon Update: After heavy monsoon rains, the cold wave is now beginning to set in. Snowfall in the mountains has brought a cold wave to the plains. Several states in North India are experiencing increased cold. Delhi-NCR is also experiencing mild chills in the mornings and evenings. According to the Meteorological Department, cold may rise in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and Jharkhand between November 10th and 11th. Over the next 4-5 days, night temperatures will be 2-4 degrees below normal in some areas of southern Haryana, northwest India, and northern central Maharashtra. Rain is also expected in some southern Indian states. Let‚Äôs find out which states have issued rain alerts.

Rain Warning in These States
According to the Meteorological Department (IMD), rain is likely in Tamil Nadu on November 12th and 13th. Furthermore, heavy rain is expected in some areas of Kerala and Mahe on November 10th. According to the Meteorological Department, cold winds are expected to blow in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and Jharkhand between November 10 and 11. Over the next 4-5 days, night temperatures may drop 4 to 7 degrees Celsius below normal in some areas of Madhya Pradesh, northern Chhattisgarh, northwest Jharkhand, and southern Haryana.

Temperatures may drop 2 to 4 degrees Celsius in the plains of northwest India and northern central Maharashtra.

Winter begins in Delhi
According to the Meteorological Department, the cold in Delhi is expected to increase over the next seven days. According to the Meteorological Department, the maximum temperature on November 10 is expected to be 27 degrees Celsius and the minimum temperature 12 degrees Celsius. Strong winds may reach up to 20 kilometres per hour in the morning and evening.

Weather conditions in Bihar
Cold has fully set in in the rural areas of Bihar. Due to snowfall in the hilly regions, the minimum temperature has dropped to 12 degrees Celsius. Cold is expected to increase in Jharkhand on November 10. Cold waves may occur in many areas of Bihar. Temperatures are expected to drop by 2 to 3 degrees Celsius in the coming days. The Meteorological Department has predicted a significant drop in temperatures in Bihar after November 15th.

The India Meteorological Department has predicted a cold wave in six districts of Jharkhand from November 10th to 12th. According to the IMD, a cold wave may occur in Palamu, Garhwa, Chatra, Gumla, Latehar, and Lohardaga districts from November 10th to 12th.

title: Typhoon Fung-Wong approaches Taiwan, schools and offices closed amid heavy rain alert - desitalkchicago.com

Typhoon Fung-Wong approaches Taiwan, schools and offices closed amid heavy rain alert
Posted on November 10, 2025 by ANI
NEXT STORY
PREVIOUS STORY

Taipei [Taiwan], November 10 (ANI): Typhoon Fung-Wong is set to make landfall in Taiwan later this week, prompting authorities to shut schools and offices as a precaution. The northern and eastern parts of the island are expected to experience heavy rainfall from Monday night as the storm approaches, according to the Central Weather Administration (CWA), as reported by Focus Taiwan.
The weather bureau said a sea warning for Typhoon Fung-Wong could be issued later on Monday.
As of 2 am, the typhoon was located about 580 kilometers south of Taiwan and moving northwest toward the Taiwan Strait. The CWA said Fung-Wong is expected to turn northeast toward Taiwan while gradually weakening.
From Monday night to Tuesday, the typhoon‚Äôs outer bands, combined with strong northeasterly winds, are likely to bring heavy downpours to Keelung, the Greater Taipei area, eastern Taiwan, and the Hengchun Peninsula in the south, the CWA said.
The bureau also warned of additional rainfall in central and southern Taiwan on Wednesday as the storm moves across the island. The weather is expected to ease by Thursday, though occasional heavy showers may still occur in the north, as per Focus Taiwan.
Citing Independent meteorologist Wu De-rong, Focus Taiwan noted that the storm‚Äôs strongest impact will be felt on Tuesday, with northern and eastern Taiwan facing intense rain. He added that conditions should gradually improve from Thursday, and sunny to cloudy skies are expected to return nationwide by Saturday.
Temperatures on Monday are forecast to range between 22 degree celsius and 24 degree C in northern Taiwan and Yilan County, while central and southern regions could see daytime highs of 30 degre C to 32 degree C, the CWA added.
Authorities in Taiwan‚Äôs largest county, Hualien, have ordered the closure of schools and offices in Guangfu Township as the storm approaches. Residents in low-lying areas have been advised to evacuate due to the threat of floods and landslides.
Landslide alerts have been issued for several villages in Guangfu Township, including Dama, Daping, Dongfu, Datong, Daan, Dahua, and Beifu, as well as Fenglin and Wanrung townships. Focus Taiwan reported.
‚ÄúResidents of these areas should evacuate immediately and move to safe shelters,‚Äù the Hualien County Government said in a statement.
Officials also urged people living near Matai‚Äôan Creek and other areas damaged by September‚Äôs barrier lake collapse to evacuate quickly, carrying essential documents, medicines, and only one piece of luggage each. (ANI)
